HOLLAND ACCEPTS DRUG TERMS
description: Al Holland, saying he would accept Commissioner Peter Ueberroth's alternatives to suspension, acknowledged today that he used cocaine during two baseball seasons in the early 1980's.

title: STOP & SHOP COMPANIES reports earnings for Qtr to Feb 1
Advertising; People
description: * Eugene F. Bartley Jr. and Richard Levenson were elected to the board of D'Arcy Masius Benton & Bowles.

title: WHITTAKER CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 31
ATICO FINANCIAL CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Including a net gain of $16,452,000, or $6.05 a share, from an exchange of stock. c-Including a gain of $3,191,000, or $1.13 a share, from the sale of property.

title: SHONEY'S SOUTH INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 29
description: b-After an extraordinary charge of $1,966,000 related to the company's termination of its obligations under a franchise agreement for the quarter and year. c-Net income

title: Market Place; Japanese Issues Draw Support
description: MANY American money managers who invest abroad showed a preference last year for European stocks over Japanese issues, which account for 40 percent of all equity markets outside of the United States in terms of size. ''The economic news was getting better in Europe, so that's where much of the money went,'' said one fund manager.

title: Costa Rica's Election Was a Fiesta Civica
description: To the Editor:

title: STYLISTS: IMPROVISING IMAGES TO CAPTURE FLEETING FASHION
description: Tina Turner arrived at a magazine cover photo session swaddled in voluminous Japanese clothes. Someone had to to talk her out of them to reveal the legs that launched a thousand songs. Barbara Dente did it.

title: PITTWAY CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
SYNBIOTICS CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
QUOTATION OF THE DAY
description: ''There were vicious, ugly forms of discrimination at Yale, as with the larger society.

title: 250,000 Pieces of Mail Saved
description: The New York Postmaster had something unusual on his hands -250,000 pieces of mail that were delivered to the right place but never received by hundreds of addressees.

title: BUSINESS DIGEST: TUESDAY, MARCH 4, 1986
description: Companies

title: I.B.M. to Raise Payment to Aetna
description: The Aetna Life and Casualty Company said it would receive an additional $68.5 million from the sale of its Satellite Business Systems to the International Business Machines Corporation. I.B.M. bought Aetna's share in S.B.S. in 1985 and announced plans to merge the operations into the MCI Communications Corporation.

title: LAWYERS MAKE LAST ARGUMENTS IN MURDER TRIAL
description: Robert O. Marshall, a prominent Toms River insurance broker, listened from the defense table today as the assistant Ocean County proscutor, summarizing a five-week murder-for-hire trial, branded him a ''self-centered coward'' who had conspired to have his wife murdered out of ''desperation and greed.''

title: HOMAC INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Including a tax credit of $157,000. c-Net loss.

title: RADIO LIBERTY AIDE VANISHES
description: The Soviet-born acting chief editor of Radio Liberty, an American-financed station that broadcasts to the Soviet Union, has been missing for a week, according to officials at the station in Munich.

title: Detour for Official Car
description: David L. Gunn got his car back, but he really does not need it now.

title: DAHLBERG INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net loss.

title: LEAFS TOP JETS, 6-1
description: Wendel Clark scored twice to set a record for most goals by a Toronto rookie in leading the Maple Leafs to a 6-1 victory over the Winnipeg Jets tonight. The victory was the first for Toronto over Winnipeg since Dec. 19, 1981. The goals gave Clark 29 for the season, one more than the total achieved by both Walt Poddubny and Peter Ihnacak during the 1982-83 season.

title: Possible Defects Are Cited In 6,400 Flight Instruments
description: Federal aviation officials today notified all aircraft owners, including the nation's airlines and the military, that about 6,400 altimeters made last year could be defective and give erroneous readings.

title: FILES SHOW KURT WALDHEIM SERVED UNDER WAR CRIMINAL
description: Kurt Waldheim, former Secretary General of the United Nations, was attached to a German Army command in World War II that fought brutal campaigns against Yugoslav partisans and engaged in mass deportations of Greek Jews, according to official documents made available here.

title: Key Rates
description: * Municipal Bond Index, The Bond BuyerSalomon Brothers estimates for bellwether issues

title: ATLANTA CLUB MAY BOW TO TRADITION OF NEWNESS
description: For more than a hundred years, it has been traditional here to think of Atlanta as new, a habit of mind that some date to the city's pride in the achievement of rebuilding itself after being burned in the Civil War.

title: FAIRMOUNT CHEMICALS CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Body Is Found at Site Of Egyptian Police Riot
description: A charred body believed to be that of a missing Danish tourist was found in the rubble of a hotel room at a hotel in the suburb of Giza that was set ablaze by rioting paramilitary policemen last week.

title: Advertising; Woman's Day Message Put on White Trucks
description: In addition to the advertising trade press and radio advertising that has already begun to run, the latest trade advertising effort from Woman's Day by Leber Katz Partners also uses three vehicles operated by the Prestige Panels division of Video Displays.

title: KNICKS LOSE AGAIN WITH EWING AILING
description: For the last five months, Bob Hill has played the dutiful assistant to Coach Hubie Brown. By charting the players' mistakes and accomplishments during every game, and aiding the forwards and centers during practices, he has been the quiet foundation of a coaching staff that has not had much to brag about this season.

title: BRAZILIANS BACK WAGE-PRICE FREEZE
description: Buoyed by strongly favorable public reactions to the wage and price freeze decreed on Friday, Brazil today began the complex task of readjusting its economy.

title: TELECONNECT, A C reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Psychiatrist, S.E.C. Settle
description: A New Canaan, Conn., psychiatrist settled charges today that he illegally traded in a company's securities after he learned of an impending merger from a patient.

title: LEECO DIAGNOSTICS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
RAX RESTAURANTS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 27
NEW WORLD PICTURES LTD reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net loss. c-Including a tax loss carry-forward of $495,000. Share earnings have been adjusted for 3-for-2 stock split on Feb. 24, 1986.

title: U.S. Delegates Attend Morocco Celebrations
description: An American delegation led by William J. Casey, the Director of Central Intelligence, attended the 25th anniversary celebration of the rule of King Hassan II today, American officials said.

title: NURSE ACCUSED OF MURDERING 2 OF HER BABIES
description: A nurse who until last year worked in the pediatrics unit at New York Hospital was arrested yesterday and charged with killing two of her three children, in 1980 and 1982, and trying to kill the third.

title: CERADYNE INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
LITTLE-KNOWN APPLIANCE GIANT
description: Ward Smith took over as chief executive at White Consolidated Industries in January, and in recent interviews he has brimmed with ideas to improve the big appliance maker's manufacturing and marketing.

title: IMATRON INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Boston Five President Rides Mortgage Boom
description: When the Boston Five Mortgage Corporation, one of New England's largest mortgage lenders, decided to lower interest rates on all of its mortgage products last week, the institution's director of lending and president said he was almost certain it would be positively received by the public. But even though Boston is currently the nation's hottest residential real estate market, Christopher R. Dunn was not expecting what he is seeing now.

title: BUDGET PRESSURE MAY IMPERIL NEW SUBMARINE
description: A high-priority Navy program to build a new class of attack submarines may be in jeopardy because of pressure to trim the deficit and eroding national support for military spending, Congressional aides and Navy officials say.

title: THE PALME STYLE: A STRONG TILT TO FOREIGN POLICY
description: As the hunt continues for the killer of Olof Palme, the slain Prime Minister is being remembered as a man who balanced a clubhouse feel for domestic politics with a passion to be recognized as a leading international spokesman for European Socialism.

title: ICN PHARMACEUTICALS INC reports earnings for Year to Nov 30
description: b-Including a writeoff of $13,664,000 for the fourth quarter representing a one-time charge against results for 1985. c-Net income.

title: LEGISLATURE PASSES BILL TO RESTORE DEATH PENALTY FOR SOME MURDERERS
description: The Legislature today gave final approval to a bill that would restore the death penalty for some murderers.

title: MILITARY JURY SENTENCES SURGEON TO 4 YEARS IN PRISON FOR DEATHS
description: A military jury today sentenced the former chief heart surgeon at Bethesda Naval Hospital to four years in prison for involuntary manslaughter and negligent homicide involving three patients.

title: TROUBLED GIRL'S EVOLUTION INTO AN OSCAR NOMINEE
description: Oprah Winfrey has been nominated for an Academy Award as best supporting actress for ''The Color Purple'' and is host of an immensely popular talk show in Chicago, but, she says, when she looks in the mirror, she sometimes sees a poor little girl with ugly, butterfly-rimmed eyeglasses.

title: COMPANY BRIEFS
description: * Allied-Signal Inc.'s Signal Energy Systems Inc., Hampton, N.H., will develop, own and operate a $30 million cogeneration plant for Metropolitan State Hospital in Norwalk, Calif.

title: SBE INC reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 31
REVISED 'OH! CALCUTTA!' IS HEADED FOR ISRAEL
description: Israelis will after all see an American production of ''Oh! Calcutta!'' with its nudity intact but with some of the sexual content expunged or toned down.

title: U N A CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 31
MANES CASE STILL BAFFLES INVESTIGATORS IN QUEENS
description: On the chill afternoon of Jan. 9, Donald R. Manes returned to his office at Queens Borough Hall and asked about a car - not one of his regular chauffeur-driven town cars, but the nondescript blue LTD Ford that he occasionally drove himself.

title: U S INTEC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Zale Blocks Offer
description: Morris B. Zale, the founder of the Zale Corporation, and members of his family said they had united to block a proposed merger of Zale with Peoples Jewellers Ltd. In a filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission, the group said it held the equivalent of 35 percent of the company's shares outstanding. In Texas, where Zale is incorporated, a merger requires the approval of at least two-thirds of all shares outstanding.

title: NEWPORT PHARMACEUTICALS INTERNATIONAL INC reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 31
description: b-Net income

title: ANTHONY F. MARRA
description: Anthony F. Marra, a former Criminal Court judge in Manhattan and on Staten Island, died after heart surgery Saturday at Mount Sinai Hospital in Miami Beach. He was 75 years old and lived in Brooklyn.

title: Chase Offering At $250 Million
description: The Chase Manhattan Corporation is offering $250 million of 8 1/2 percent notes due in 1996 at a price of 99.599, to yield 8.56 percent through underwriters led by Morgan Stanley & Company.

title: Advertising; Medicus Intercon Adds Consumer Drug Unit
description: Medicus Intercon, an international health-care specialty advertising agency, has a new Consumer Communications unit that, according to Joseph T. Davis, executive vice president and managing director, will specialize in making ads for drug products that were formerly prescription brands and are now sold over the counter. It will also do informative advertising on particular diseases designed to get consumers to go to physicians who may then prescribe a client's product, and do advertising for hospital chains or health maintainence organizations.

title: U.S. STEEL LIFTS PRICES OF SHEETS
description: The United States Steel Corporation, apparently looking forward to a firmer market for sheet steel, announced price increases on all sheet products effective May 5.

title: FIBRONICS INTERNATIONAL reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: Share earnings reflect a 3-for-2 stock split in June 1985.

title: SUSPECT, 30, IS SLAIN
description: An 84-year-old man fought off a robber yesterday, and, as the two men struggled, the robber was fatally shot with his own gun, the police said.

title: Nashville Scene-Stealing
description: The Rev. Pat Robertson, the television evangelist who has announced he is praying over whether to pursue the Republican nomination for President in 1988, utterly upstaged other Presidential hopefuls this weekend in Nashville, where southern Republicans were meeting. Not only did he dominate the news with an attack on the Democratic Party chairman, Paul G. Kirk Jr., he also managed a cultural coup of sorts.

title: THUNANDER CORP reports earnings for Year to Dec 31
DALTON COMMUNICATIONS reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net income.

title: UNIVERSITIES SEEK BLACK SOUTH AFRICANS
description: A GROWING number of American colleges and universities are seeking to attract black South African students to their campuses, according to officials who run programs aimed at placing such students.

title: NORD RESOURCES CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
ECHOES OF A CLASH: PHILADELPHIA MAYOR'S SURVIVAL AT STAKE
description: Has Mayor W. Wilson Goode now taken one blow too many? Will it be politically fatal? Some Philadelphia politicians, but not all, say the answer may be yes.

title: THERMALATOR FINANCIAL CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
PHILIPPINES MOVES TO RECOVER MONEY MARCOS TOOK OUT
description: The new Government of the Philippines moved in Federal District Court in Hawaii today to recover millions of dollars in currency taken by Ferdinand E. Marcos and his party when they left the country last week.

title: Advertising;
description: DHL Worldwide Express, which pretty much had the international express business to itself before Federal joined the act, is now introducing a new product to help keep its market lead.

title: Unwanted Destination
description: As a southbound Lexington Avenue express pulled out of the Union Square-14th Street station yesterday morning, the conductor announced the next stop:

title: U.S. PANEL URGES TESTING WORKERS FOR USE OF DRUGS
description: The President's Commission on Organized Crime, completing 32 months of investigation, today recommended a widespread national program to test most working Americans for drug use.

title: Turner-MGM/UA
description: Ted Turner and his fellow stockholders, as expected, approved the entrepreneur's takeover of the MGM/UA Entertainment Company, which could open new doors for his cable television system.

title: UNION UNSURE ON GRIEVANCES
description: Donald Fehr, executive director of the Major League Baseball Players Association, said today he wouldn't know until later this week whether the union would file grievances against any of the penalties Commissioner Peter Ueberroth has levied against 21 players on drug-related matters.

title: 2 New Haven Newspapers
description: The family that controls two newspapers in New Haven, The Journal Courier and The New Haven Register, has engaged an investment banker to evaluate its properties. Newspaper industry sources said yesterday that a sale of the two papers could bring about $160 million.

title: SECURITY TAG SYSTEMS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
The Murder of More Than a Mayor
description: As intended, the murder of the Mayor of Nablus in the West Bank reunites the extremist Arabs and Israelis who want to hold a million Palestinians hostage to their rival territorial designs. Mayor Zafer el-Masri, a leading businessman from a prominent family, had defied the all-or-nothing sloganeering. He had worked to arrange some genuine self-government in the Israeli-occupied region. He accepted appointment from Prime Minister Peres, with the encouragement of Yasir Arafat of the P.L.O. and the tacit approval of King Hussein.

title: ARGUELLO BOUT SET
description: Alexis Arguello continues to fight in a comeback that began last October, more than two years after he had retired. Arguello has signed to fight another former champion, Gene Hatcher.

title: THE BREWERS REBUILD
description: At other spring training camps, a sore arm or a pulled muscle is often considered a calamity. But at their new complex here near Phoenix, the Milwaukee Brewers know what a calamity is. Three coaches - Tony Muser, Herm Starrette and Larry Haney - remain hospitalized with severe burns from last Thursday's flaming natural-gas explosion. Workmen in yellow hard hats rebuild the roof of the Brewers' clubhouse, which is wrapped in yellow ''keep out'' tape.

title: Iran Says It Captured Strategic Iraqi Heights
description: Iran asserted today that its forces had captured strategic heights in northeast Iraq and killed more than 500 Iraqi soldiers on the Fao Peninsula in the south.

title: COLLINS INDUSTRIES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 31
description: b-After a loss of $44,639 from discontinued operations.

title: Liability Insurance in Crisis
description: In Missouri, loss of insurance forced the closing of a county jail. In New York City it halted the Roosevelt Island cable tram. California's Orange County was socked with a sixfold increase in its premium. The police in West Orange, N.J., had to stop patrolling in cars they could no longer insure.

title: BUILDING THE ONE WHERE DIPLOMATS PLACE WALLS
description: The diplomatic game can be played on many levels in this town.

title: TIMES WHEN KEY DECISION IS TO ALERT OR NOT TO ALERT
description: All tournament players listen alertly for the ''alert'' announcement that tells them the opponents are employing a special bidding agreement. There are times when the alert comes as a surprise, but in other situations the failure to alert may be unexpected.

title: FACTORY MACHINES THAT 'SEE'
description: After decades of research and development, a key element in the automation of American factories - devices that allow machines to ''see'' -is falling into place.

title: NEW TRANSPORTATION CHIEF FOR CITY OUSTS 6 TOP AIDES
description: The new Commissioner of the city's Department of Transportation dismissed six top officials yesterday, his first day on the job, and announced a wide-ranging reorganization of the agency.

title: A False 'Parallel'
description: President Reagan, citing parallels where none exist between the Philippines and Nicaragua, insisted to members of Congress in a White House meeting that ''we stood for democracy in the Philippines; we have to stand for democracy in Nicaragua and throughout Central America and in our hemisphere.''

title: Q & A
description: Q.

title: MARKET SLIPS BELOW THE 1,700 LEVEL
description: Profit taking gave Wall Street its biggest loss yesterday in nearly two weeks, with the Dow Jones industrial average closing below the 1,700 level for the first time since last Wednesday.

title: HOUSE PANEL GETS A WARNING ON AIR TRAFFIC CONTROL PERILS
description: Members of a House subcommittee on aviation were told today that while the skies over the New York-New Jersey region were safe, air traffic controllers were being pushed to the limit and tragedies could occur.

title: NORDIC-U.S. ALL-STAR MATCH ENDS IN 12-12 TIE IN ICELAND
description: The Visa All-Star Match, which pitted the top dozen Nordic players against the top dozen Americans, ended in a 12-12 tie here at the Loftleider Hotel.

title: ENSTAR INDONESIA INC reports earnings for Year to Dec 31
CONCENTRATION IS LIKENED TO EUPHORIC STATES OF MIND
description: THE seemingly simple act of being fully absorbed in a challenging task is now being seen as akin to some of the extravagantly euphoric states such as those sought in drugs or sex or through the ''runner's high.''

title: VARITRONIC SYSTEMS reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 31
description: b-Net loss.

title: TIMBERLAND INDUSTRIES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
LASERCAD LTD reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
PERINI INVESTMENT PROPERIES reports earnings for Year to Dec 31
SPACECRAFT CONVERGE FOR FIRST LOOK AT COMET
description: SCIENTISTS who study the solar system have waited years for this moment. Anyone who has looked in awe upon comets will now be seeing the most famous one revealed as never before.

title: JUDGE'S RULING WOULD ALLOW FARM FORECLOSURES BY U.S.
description: A Federal district judge today refused to block the Farmers Home Administration from resuming foreclosure procedures, which could end a two-year moratorium.

title: JUSTICES TO HEAR CASE ON POCKET VETO
description: The Supreme Court agreed today to hear a major case involving the pocket veto power of the President and the right of Congress or its members to challenge Presidential actions in court.

title: COLLEGE FOR THE ELDERLY: A JAPANESE MODEL
description: ATEACHER was lecturing about violence among children in American and Japanese schools. The speaker was Japanese. He was surprised when the classroom door opened and in came an American who might throw some light on at least the American side of the issue.

title: Baseball Bargains With Drugs
description: Baseball Commissioner Peter Ueberroth had the best intentions last week when he handed down punishment for 21 drug-abusing players. His penalties, unfortunately, suffered by immediate comparison with the example of Micheal Ray Richardson and by the reaction of Keith Hernandez.

title: WINNING SPIRIT OVERCOMES JITTERY NERVE
description: It was their first cheerleading and pompon competition ever, and the Ocean Township High junior varsity girls had the jitters - they admitted it.

title: Warsaw Begins Trial Of Five Activists
description: Five activists of a small opposition party openly hostile to the Soviet Union went on trial today on charges of leading an illegal organization.

title: MAJOR REALTY CORP reports earnings for Year to Dec 31
description: b-Including an extraordinary credit of $264,000. The company changed to a calendar year from a fiscal year ending May 31 and said prior year figures were not available.

title: MARCOS HOLDINGS FROZEN BY JUDGE
description: A New York State Supreme Court Judge said yesterday that he had issued a temporary restraining order in a case involving four pieces of real estate in Manhattan and one on Long Island that the new Philippine Government contends were acquired with funds improperly amassed by Ferdinand E. Marcos while he was President of the Philippines.

title: NRM ENERGY CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After a non-cash charge of $109 million for the writedown of oil and gas assets for the quarter and $141 million for the year. c-Net income.

title: HOSPITAL STAFFING SERVICES reports earnings for Qtr to Nov 30
description: b-Including extraordinary tax credits of $29,000 for the quarter and $89,000 for the year. c-Net loss.

title: GENERAL REFRACTORIES CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Including extraordinary tax benefits of $1,000,000 for the quarter and $1,350,000 for the year. The year result also is after nonrecurring costs of $2,610,000 and a provison of $1,525,000 for separation pay and includes a gain of $1.2 million from the sale of assets. c-After a charge of $100,000 for the quarter and including an extraordinary tax benefit of $800,000 for the year. The year result also includes a gain of $2 million from the sale of assets.

title: PRIVATE BUS HITS FOUR PEDESTRIANS
description: A private bus collided with a van at a busy midtown intersection during the afternoon rush yesterday and, mounting a crowded sidewalk, struck four pedestrians, including a 3-year-old boy who was seriously hurt.

title: 'RUM AND COKE' SIBLINGS CREATE THEIR OWN FAMILY
description: At the center of ''Rum and Coke,'' Keith Reddin's dark comedy about the Bay of Pigs invasion, stand the brother and sister played, to critical praise, by Peter MacNicol and Polly Draper. Amid the play's espionage and geopolitics, these are siblings as they might have been imagined by a fan of Graham Greene, which Mr. Reddin happens to be.

title: GENESCO INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Including a gain of $1,881,000 from an excess provision for future losses of discontinued operations for the quarter and year. c-Net income including a reversal of a tax credit of $1,296,000 for the quarter and an excess provision for future losses of discontinued operations of $4,306,000 for the year. The year result also includes a tax credit of $1,880,000.

title: DYNAMICS RESEARCH CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After losses from discontinued operations of $222,000 for the quarter and $2,046,000 for the year. c-After losses form discontinued operations of $175,000 for the quarter and $466,000 for the year. Share earnings have been adjusted for a 5-for-4 stock split paid in December 1985.

title: JOHNSON ELECTRONICS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net loss. c-Including net gain of $195,000 on the sale of property.

title: BROKERAGE DISPUTE IN HIGH COURT
description: The Supreme Court agreed today to decide a dispute between the banking and securities industries over whether discount brokerage services owned by banks are subject to Federal geographical restrictions on bank branches.

title: LIFELINE SYSTEMS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After tax credits of $321,000 for the quarter and $533,000 for the year. c-Net loss

title: Two Power Utilities In Bond Refundings
description: Two large electric power authorities in Michigan and Minnesota are taking advantage of the sharp decline in interest rates to sell nearly $600 million of new tax-exempt bonds to refund bonds they issued a few years ago when interest rates were much higher.

title: Careers; Philosophy Majors in Demand
description: AN industry of the future - artificial intelligence - needs philosophers.

title: REUTER INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
SOVIET PREMIER, IN CONGRESS TALK, CRITICIZES ECONOMY
description: Prime Minister Nikolai I. Ryzhkov said today that red tape, cost overruns, obsolete construction projects and a lag in applied research were crippling the economy.

title: PATTERN PROCESSING TECHNOLOGIES reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
FOR EASIER COMPUTING, START RIGHT WITH DOS
description: GO through any filing cabinet and you'll come across folders on which the old labels have been crossed out and new ones scribbled in. In the files of the tidiest, new tabs have been pasted over the old ones to cover up the past. In either case, the changes have been made because the old descriptive keys no longer applied. A file became too thick and was split into two, for instance, or a project name was changed.

title: U.S. MAPS OUT TRAIL OF CASH IN NAVY SPYING CASE
description: Federal prosecutors said today they would detail how a Navy communications specialist purchased luxury goods with thousands of dollars in cash, which, they say, he received from the Soviet Union in exchange for military secrets.

title: Bond Prices Continue to Climb
description: Bond prices continued to rise sharply yesterday, spurred by strong demand from speculators and investors, both foreign and domestic.

title: King and Cowles
description: King Features Syndicate, the world's leading distributor of newspaper comics and features, said that it would buy Cowles Syndicate Inc. of Des Moines for an undisclosed amount. Cowles, formerly the Register and Tribune Syndicate, offers 35 features. King Features is a unit of the Hearst Corporation.

title: INTEK DIVERSIFIED CORP reports earnings for Year to Dec 31
Nicaragua Week
description: With President Reagan locked in a duel with Congress over aid to the Nicaraguan guerrillas known as contras, supporters of the Administration, official and nominally otherwise, are quickening the tempo this week.

title: WAL-MART STORES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 31
description: The share earnings reflect a 100 percent stock dividend paid Oct. 4, 1985.

title: Gas Concern Gets KN Offer
description: KN Energy Inc., a natural gas distribution company based in Lakewood, Colo., said yesterday that it had begun an offer to acquire all the shares of the Rocky Mountain Natural Gas Company that it does not already own, for $14 a share, or about $19.6 million.

title: MUSIC: LAURIE ANDERSON AT THE BEACON
description: LAURIE ANDERSON, the rock-flavored performance artist, has been lying low of late. But she's hardly been idle, since she's made a feature-length concert film, ''Home of the Brave,'' which is scheduled for April release, prepared a forthcoming soundtrack album and gotten a touring show together for a two-month excursion through the United States and Asia. It was that show that arrived for a sold-out appearance Sunday night at the Beacon Theater, following warm-up dates in Boston and Philadelphia.

title: DOWN TO THREE
description: The Generals are left with only three players who were members of the original 1983 squad after trading Sam Bowers, the tight end, yesterday to the Memphis Showboats.

title: Indiana Utility
description: The Public Service Company of Indiana said it had avoided default after winning a two-week extension on a $150 million credit agreement with a consortium of banks. A Public Service spokesman, Chris Combs, said company officials obtained the postponement late Sunday and would ask the consortium of 22 banks to extend the agreement through April.

title: Change at BP North America
description: BP North America Inc., a subsidiary of the British Petroleum Company, yesterday named Ian G. S. Hartigan president, effective April 24.

title: 'GENERAL CONTRACTOR' OF THE WHITE HOUSE STAFF
description: By his own reckoning, W. Dennis Thomas is exactly where he wants to be: in the thick of White House traffic, with the Oval Office on one side and the office of Donald T. Regan, President Reagan's chief of staff, on the other.

title: IN THE PECKING ORDER, PLUMES MAKE THE BIRD
description: IN this age of social mobility and sartorial informality, clothes may or may not make the man. But recent experiments strongly suggest that for some birds at least, plumage patterns do define social rank, even when the markings are merely fakes created by human beings. There's food for thought in this, and scientists are duly munching on it.

title: UNITED STOCKYARDS CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 31
VITRONICS CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
JEWISH THEOLOGICAL SEMINARY CHOOSES SCHORSCH A CHANCELLOR
description: Dr. Ismar Schorsch, a refugee from Nazi Germany who is a scholar of European Jewish history and a seasoned administrator, yesterday was named chancellor of the Jewish Theological Seminary, the central institution of America's 1.2 million Conservative Jews.

title: BOLD LINES IN DENIM AND LINEN
description: Isabel Toledo has been in business just one year but she's already making herself heard in the fashion world. Her clothes don't exactly shout, but they do stand out from the crowd, enough so for Bergdorf Goodman to put them in the 57th Street windows this week.

title: G.M. TO BUY BACK $2 BILLION OF STOCK
description: The General Motors Corporation today announced a plan to buy back nearly $2 billion of its stock, including about one-third of the shares the auto maker issued late last year to acquire the Hughes Aircraft Company.

title: Business and the Law; An Alternative To Litigation
description: FOR businesses that want to cut down the time and money they spend on lawsuits, there is a way to get out of the litigation habit: take what is known as the ADR Pledge.

title: SARATOGA STANDARDBREDS INC reports earnings for Year to Nov 30
Top-Level Briefing
description: Jewish leaders assembling here tomorrow under the auspices of the Conference of Presidents of Major Jewish Organizations have been informed that President Reagan himself will be among key Administration figures who, in closed sessions, will brief them on critical issues affecting Israel and the Mideast.

title: How to Eliminate Cheating on Gas Excise Taxes
description: To the Editor:

title: MURRAY LOUIS PREMIERES
description: Three premieres and two revivals will be given during a three-week engagement by the Murray Louis Dance Company, beginning April 2 at the Joyce Theater, 175 Eighth Avenue, at 19th Street.

title: SHOWER OF EVENTS IN MARCH
description: T. S. Eliot was wrong. April is not the cruelest month.

title: RAGAN, BRAD INC reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 31
description: b-Net loss.

title: INLAND VACUUM INDUSTRIES reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
INSTRON CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Including a tax loss carry-forward of $119,000 for the quarter and $452,000 for the year. c-After the reversal of a tax loss carry-forward of $181,000 for the quarter and, for the year, after a tax loss of $1,695,000 from termination of product lines in the United Kingdom.

title: WEILL OFFER OF $1 BILLION IS REJECTED
description: After a five-hour board meeting in Los Angeles, directors of the BankAmerica Corporation last night rejected an offer by Sanford I. Weill, former president of the American Express Company, to raise $1 billion in new capital if he were named to run the troubled bank.

title: GOING OUT GUIDE
description: HOMETOWN GIRL Growing up in Brooklyn, Ruby Stevens was a tough orphan. She achieved success in the Broadway theater and, moving on to Hollywood, became the glamorous movie star Barbara Stanwyck. Today, beginning with a triple feature, the Thalia theater will present a 32-film retrospective, ''Starring Barbara Stanwyck,'' which will play every Tuesday through May 13.

title: The U.N. Today: March 4, 1986
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY Committee on the Elimination of Racial Discrimination - 10:30 A.M. and 3 P.M.

title: FARMLAND ANTI-SEMITIC PITCH ISN'T TAKING HOLD
description: Efforts by extremist groups to exploit farm problems with anti-Semitic propaganda, a trend widely noticed in recent months, have been generally rejected in the rural Middle West, according to a poll by Louis Harris & Associates.

title: What Defense-Spending Gap?
description: President Reagan is again asking for more military spending, and, as before, he partly bases his case on an overstatement of Soviet military outlays.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: An article last Tuesday on the planned takeover of Eastern Airlines by the Texas Air Corporation incorrectly identified the airline that sold Eastern a network of Latin American routes. It was Braniff Airways.

title: WASHINGTON REAL ESTATE INVESTMENT TRUST reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Including gains from sales of real estate of $1,147,762, or 17 cents a share, for the quarter and $3,771,479, or 46 cents a share, for the year.

title: STAGE: 'JUBILEE'
description: THE same spirit of madcap fun that animates the current Broadway revival of Noel Coward's play ''Hay Fever'' wafted through the New Amsterdam Theater Company's concert revival of the Cole Porter-Moss Hart musical ''Jubilee'' on Sunday afternoon at Town Hall. The 1935 show tells of a European royal family who seize the first opportunity that comes along to escape the pressures of the crown and act like everyday people.

title: ORIGINS OF POTHOLES MORE THAN WEATHER
description: Streets erupt in potholes for several reasons: thawing and freezing in the spring, wear and tear from heavy use, delayed reconstruction of roads, and poorly repaired cuts into streets by utilities.

title: DASH INDUSTRIES INC reports earnings for Year to Nov 30
description: b-Including a tax credit of $42,621. c-Including a tax credit of $77,851.

title: CHROMALLOY AMERICAN CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After losses from discontinued operations of $1,595,000 for the quarter and $2,723,000 for the year. c-Net loss. After preferred dividends, there were no share earnings in the latest year.

title: WEAPON CONFISCATED
description: Martina Navratilova apparently routinely carries a pistol, which she checks with her luggage when traveling.

title: SURGICAL CARE AFFILIATIES reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
A HARBINGER OF SPRING: POTHOLE PATROLS BEGIN
description: With a hint of spring in the air, the team from the Automobile Club of New York set out yesterday for the first ''pothole patrol'' of the year.

title: LEADING HOSPITALS ACCUSED BY STATE AIDE OF POOR CARE
description: Some of New York City's leading private and public teaching hospitals were accused by a state official at a hearing yesterday of having killed or injured patients through incompetent, negligent or inadequate medical and surgical care.

title: JOSEPH V. HEFFERNAN
description: Joseph V. Heffernan, a lawyer and former financial vice president and director of the National Broadcasting Company, died Sunday at his home in Ardsley-on-Hudson, N.Y. He was 80 years old.

title: Woodrow Wilson Faced a Marcos-Type Situation
description: To the Editor:

title: Zambian Creditor Talks
description: Zambia's Finance Minister, Luke Mwananshiku, has left for talks in France with Western creditor nations, a ministry spokesman said today. His trip follows last week's announcement in Washington that the International Monetary Fund has allocated $345 million to help Zambia offset losses in export earnings caused by low prices for copper.

title: IN CHAOTIC NIGERIA, BREAD AND ROADBLOCKS ENDURE
description: Toward evening, just before the day's heat begins its reluctant nocturnal retreat, the bread ladies come out.

title: AQUINO'S UPHILL PATH
description: One of Corazon C. Aquino's greatest assets as a presidential candidate was her widely accepted public image not as a professional politician, but as a gracious and principled woman who did not stoop to deals and compromises.

title: DRESS BARN INC reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 25
description: Share earnings have been adjusted for 2-for-1 stock split May 3, 1985.

title: No Joy for Leopards
description: To the Editor:

title: Massey-Ferguson Plan
description: Shareholders of Massey-Ferguson Ltd. will meet March 26 to consider a financial restructuring plan that would convert a substantial part of the company's debt of about $280 million to a new class of senior preferred shares. Most of the remaining loans would be extended to 12-year maturities.

title: WILLCOX & GIBBS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After tax credits of $1,523,000 for the quarter and $5,090,000 for the year. c-After tax credits of $882,000 for the quarter and $4,327,000 for the year.

title: BARRY BLAU & PARTNERS reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net income. Revenue results reflect revenue and fees amounts.

title: ZIMMER CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Includes a pre-tax charge of $2,440,000 on the disposal of a subsidiary for the quarter and year. c-Includes a pre-tax charge of $1,400,000 for a restructuring of that subsidiary for the quarter and year.

title: CHINA'S DANCE DOYENNE BRINGS TROUPE TO U.S.
description: When Dai Ailian, now considered the grande dame of dance in China, arrived in London to study ballet in the 1930's, she naturally hoped to become a dancer.

title: 2 ISLANDERS TO SUIT UP
description: Two notable Islander players were expected to return to action against the Montreal Canadiens tonight at Nassau Coliseum.

title: CONCHEMCO INC reports earnings for Qtr to Feb 1
WEBCOR ELECTRONICS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
SYNALLOY CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 28
description: b-Including income from discontinued operations of $5,292 for the quarter and $17,366 for the year.

title: LAW LIMITING OWNERSHIP OF U.S. BANKS URGED
description: The Soviet Union's secret effort in the mid-1970's to acquire three banks in northern California and an interest in a fourth would be illegal under legislation introduced in Congress yesterday by two New York Democrats, Senator Daniel Patrick Moynihan and Representative Charles E. Schumer.

title: CONTRA AID VITAL, REAGAN DECLARES
description: President Reagan warned Congress today of a ''strategic disaster'' if it failed to approve military assistance to the Nicaraguan insurgents. He said they would be crushed like ''the Hungarian freedom fighters'' without the aid.

title: Some on Peace March Quit After Two Days
description: About 200 of 1,200 peace marchers, dissatisfied by a lack of showers and procedures for food rationing, have dropped out of a cross-country trek for nuclear disarmament after two days, officials said today.

title: SMITH LABORATORIES reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 31
description: b-Net income

title: Suspect in 14 Killings Has Court Hearing
description: The long-awaited preliminary hearing of the man accused of killing 14 people, began today with an effort by the defense to suppress crucial evidence in the case.

title: M.P.'S IN MANILA HAIL 'DE FACTO' CHIEF
description: Corazon C. Aquino was hailed as de facto President today by the leaders of the Parliament majority that had pronounced her the electoral loser only two weeks ago.

title: BRADLEY RECORDS 21ST STRAIGHT VICTORY
description: With Mike Williams scoring 18 points, Bradley extended its winning streak to 21 games with a 61-55 victory over West Texas State today in the first round of the Missouri Valley Conference tournament.

title: ITALIAN SYNAGOGUE MAY BE OLDEST IN EUROPE
description: BOVA MARINA, Italy - Archeologists in this remote coastal area of southern Italy have discovered the ruins of a synagogue built at the time of the Roman Empire.

title: ROWLEY-SCHER REPROGRAPHCS reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
DRUG TESTS IN BRITAIN
description: Britain's leading amateur golfers will have to submit to drug tests even though one official said, ''As far as we know, there is no benefit that can be derived from drugs on the golf course.''

title: ALBERTSON'S INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Including a pretax gain of $55,000 from LIFO adjustments for the quarter and after pretax charges of $9,170,000 from LIFO adjustments for the year. c-Including a pretax gain of $2,478,000 from LIFO adjustments for the quarter and after pretax charges of $11,385,000 for the year, also from LIFO adjustments.

title: NOTES ON FASHION
description: THE major fall shows don't start until next week in Milan, Italy, and don't finish until early May on Seventh Avenue, but store buyers have been getting previews of coming attractions right here in New York. Four fashion trade fairs have been going on at the Coliseum and various hotels, spotlighting fall styles from various cities here and abroad. Although there were 1,250 lines shown at the New York Pret, 60 at the Italian Donna Moda and 50 at the France Fashion Show, some of the best clothes are at the small Fashion Coterie.

title: VALLONE NAMES AN INVESTIGATOR IN CITY INQUIRY
description: The number of city, state and Federal investigators looking into municipal corruption grew by one yesterday, when the new majority leader of the City Council named his own investigator.

title: HIPOTRONICS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Nov 30
FROST & SULLIVAN INC reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 31
description: b-Net income.

title: TUESDAY SPORTS
description: Basketball Knicks vs. Washington Bullets, at Madison Square Garden, 7:35 P.M. The Knicks may not go to the playoffs this season, but they are playing well against the Bullets. The season series is tied at two games each. (Television - MSG, 7:30 P.M. Radio - WPAT, 930; 7:20 P.M.) Nets vs. Detroit Pistons, at Pontiac, Mich. The Nets have won the last two meetings between the teams, but both games were played in Byrne Meadowlands Arena. The Pistons are now back in the Silverdome, where they won the first two games of the season series. (Television - SportsChannel, 11:30 A.M., tape. Radio - WNBC, 660; 7:30 P.M.) College: Big Eight tournament, at Kansas City, Mo. Big South tournament, at Savannah, Ga. Boxing Henry Tillman vs. Reggie Gross, at Atlantic City, Resorts International Hotel and Casino, heavyweights, 10 rounds. First preliminary, 8:30 P.M. The undefeated Tillman has scored seven knockouts in nine professional victories since he won a gold medal in the Olympics in Los Angeles. Gross, from Baltimore, is 18-3 with 13 knockouts. (Television - ESPN, 9 P.M.) Kevin Moley vs. Don King, at Atlantic City, Tropicana Hotel and Casino, junior middleweights, 10 rounds. First preliminary, 7:30 P.M. Hockey Islanders vs. Montreal Canadiens, at Uniondale, L.I., Nassau Coliseum, 8:05 P.M. The Islanders have not done well against the Canadiens this season, losing twice. (Television - SportsChannel, 8 P.M. Radio -WOR, 710; 8 P.M.) Devils vs. Washington Capitals, at Landover, Md.

title: INTERMARK INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net loss.

title: BOOKS OF THE TIMES
description: THE RANDLORDS. By Geoffrey Wheatcroft. 314 pages. Illustrated. Atheneum. $17.95. ONE of the countless changes that the triumph of the bourgeoisie brought with it in the 19th century was - relatively speaking - the democratization of diamonds. Where they had once been the prerogative of the very rich, in Europe and North America they became a familiar object of middle-class desire (the diamond engagement ring above all), and by mid-century potential demand had far outstripped the supply.

title: For a Soviet Role in Mideast Diplomacy
description: Middle East diplomacy is once again in limbo, and a ''time for reflection'' has been announced in Washington. The trouble is that such reflections may well prove that the whole enterprise - it is really an industry - of Middle East diplomacy has for years been irrelevant to the real issues of the region. What we need now is not so much reflection as a decisive push by the superpowers.

title: ECONOMISTS WARNING THAT INFLATION ISN'T DEAD
description: Many economists are warning that the euphoria that has sent the stock and bond markets soaring to record levels in recent weeks has been overdone. Attributing the bull markets to a surge of confidence that inflation at last has been beaten, the economists warn that rising prices again could become a problem.

title: AN AUTHOR'S MISGIVINGS
description: IT is Rafael Yglesias's position that instead of literature and truth, many young writers are out exclusively for fame and fortune. ''I'm not saying that's true of a whole generation,'' the 3l-year-old novelist contends. ''But a lot are really diseased with ambition.''

title: COMINGS AND GOINGS
description: The new coach of the football St. Louis Cardinals, Gene Stallings, has named Jim Johnson as his defensive-line coach. Johnson was defensive coordinator and defensive-backs coach for the Jacksonsonville Bulls and Oklahoma Outlaws of the U.S.F.L. the previous two seasons.

title: PINETREE COMPUTER SYSTEMS reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
PROTESTANTS SHUT DOWN ULSTER
description: A general strike organized by Protestants paralyzed commerce and transportation today in much of Northern Ireland.

title: SIMULATING VISION IN 4 STEPS
description: Most companies designing vision systems for machines describe vision as a four-part process:

title: ENERGY ASSETS INTERNATIONAL CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After a writeoff of $135,000 of lease costs from its prospect generation business.

title: BELAFONTE SAYS HE WON'T RUN FOR SENATE SEAT
description: Harry Belafonte said no to a run for the United States Senate yesterday. But like a good politician he took 20 minutes to do so, then spent 25 minutes answering questions and swiping at President Reagan, Mayor Koch, some black politicians and politicians generally.

title: WELLS-GARDNER ELECTRONICS CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net loss.

description: b-Including extraordinary credits of $4,500 for the quarter and $46,000 for the year. c-Including extraordinary credits of $40,000 for the quarter and $95,000 for the year.

title: KEY CONFIRMS TALKS WITH SCHERING
description: Key Pharmaceuticals Inc., a Miami company known for its innovations in methods of administering drugs, said yesterday that it was considering a merger into the much larger Schering-Plough Inc.

title: BUILDING OUTLAYS UP
description: Construction spending rose a modest nine-tenths of 1 percent in January, the Commerce Department said today. A healthy gain in new home and apartment building offset weakness in factory construction.

title: Japan Air Rival's Debut
description: All Nippon Airways made its debut today as Japan's second international carrier, breaking Japan Air Lines' 30-year monopoly. An All Nippon 317-seat Lockeed Trister jet left Narita Airport for Guam with 285 passengers to inaugurate four flights a week.

title: STEEGO CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 31
description: b-Includes a tax benefit of $690,000. c-Net income

title: HEALING QUICKLY
description: Joe Theismann was apparently serious when he said he would play again in 1986.

title: SKATING REMOVES FENCES
description: You grow up in a neighborhood, and it is almost as if there are these huge fences blocking the view of what's out there. Dan Dorion did not dislike Astoria. ''I'm proud of where I grew up,'' he said. ''It's made me the person I am today. I just think there's not much for young kids.'' Dorion just wanted to scale that fence, to see the other side. What he wanted the most was ice. He grew up two blocks from the elevated subway, not far from Queensboro Plaza, an area that until now has never been linked to places like Warroad, Minn., and Sault Ste. Marie, Ontario, where hockey is the only game to play. Dorion began by playing roller hockey at the Long Island City Y.M.C.A., and learned to ice skate as a 9-year-old at the World's Fair rink. He advanced to the New Hyde Park Arrows of the Met junior league and the team at All Hallows High School in the Bronx.

title: FIRST FARWEST CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After a loss of about $1.65 million, primarily through additional charges to insurance reserves, and including a gain of $1.25 million, or 95 cents, from termination of an over-funded pension plan, both for the quarter and year.

title: CHARLES HALLECK, A G.O.P. HOUSE LEADER, DIES
description: Former Representative Charles A. Halleck of Indiana, the ''100 percent Republican,'' as he called himself, who served as both the majority and the minority leader of the House of Representatives in a 34-year political career, died today in Lafayette, Ind. He was 85 years old and had been ill with pneumonia.

title: POST STILL HOPES FOR TOURNEY BID
description: They have a record of 24-3 this season - give or take five games - and one of the losses came at the Carrier Dome, where they fell to Syracuse by 19 but were within 10-point range with four minutes to play. So, are the Pioneers of C. W. Post ready for the big time, or at least the lower echelon of the big time?

title: Advertising; Dual Y.&R. Losses To Bozell
description: YOUNG & RUBICAM learned yesterday that it had lost the $45 million Merrill Lynch account to Bozell, Jacobs, Kenyon & Eckhardt, a Lorimar subsidiary.

title: COUNTING THE CALLS FOR MILITARY WITNESSES
description: Some senior Defense Department officials have recently argued that Congress has abused its responsbilities for overseeing, becoming more of a hindrance than a help with requests for facts, figures, studies and personal testimony.

title: CHILEAN ENVOY IS AMONG 12 KILLED IN CARACAS OFFICE FIRE
description: The Chilean Ambassador and at least 11 other people were killed here today when a fire broke out in a building housing Chilean Embassy offices.

title: Dynamics, Cessna
description: The General Dynamics Corporation said that its $680 million merger with the Cessna Aircraft Company had been completed, consummating a deal delayed by the Navy's prohibition on new Government contracts with General Dynamics. Under the merger, Cessna, based in Wichita, Kan., becomes a subsidiary of General Dynamics, based in suburban St. Louis. The suspensions on General Dynamics were lifted last month.

title: GRANTREE CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 31
description: b-Net income.

title: Libbey Chief Shifts Long-Term Focus
description: As a young man, Don T. McKone served under one of the canniest tacticians in military history, Gen. George S. Patton. Forty years later, Mr. McKone, the chairman and chief executive of Libbey-Owens-Ford, is applying some tough strategies of his own to improve his company's bottom line.

title: DOES MARCOS DESERVE U.S. ASYLUM?
description: The Reagan Administration's decision last week to grant refuge in the United States to former President Ferdinand E. Marcos of the Philippines has drawn virtually unanimous approval and very little criticism in Washington. As the decision was formulated, it was apparently not the subject of any serious disagreement within the Administration, and it has received bipartisan support in Congress, where Democrats as well as Republicans have been praising the Administration's handling of the crisis.

title: INTERPHASE CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 31
Big Feet on Lafayette Ave.
description: A giant pair of red ballet slippers -30 feet from heel to toe - are dangling from the cornice of the five-story Brooklyn Academy of Music at Lafayette Avenue and Ashland Place.

title: Diamond Crystal
description: The Diamond Crystal Salt Company said its chairman, Frederick S. Moore, had received an unsolicited offer from Gabelli & Company to buy all the company's stock outstanding for $32 a share, or a total of about $82 million. Diamond Crystal had no comment on the offer, whichGabelli made on behalf of Gabelli-Rosenthal & Partners.

title: FIRST AMERICAN FINANCIAL CORP reports earnings for Year to Dec 31
MAYOR MASTERS THE ART OF WALKING SAFE LINE BETWEEN REBELS AND ARMY
description: Unlike most local Filipino politicians, Mayor Emiliano Forbes has no bodyguards. After dark in this town on the Bataan Peninsula, along the route of the infamous World War II death march, he even personally greets strangers at his gate.

title: INTERDYNE CO reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 31
description: b-Including a one-time accounting charge of $1,809,000.

title: CHICAGO INQUIRY DISTRACTS MAYOR AS MAJOR POLITICAL TEST NEARS
description: The slowly unfurling allegations of wrongdoing against some of Mayor Harold Washington's aides and City Council allies seem to have thrown into disarray an administration that in early December was confident it had finally found its stride.

title: ON 'MAIN STREET,' SEX AND THE YOUNG
description: ''MAIN STREET,'' the highly praised monthly program for young people, examines a fearsome subject today. ''That subject, my buddies,'' Bryant Gumbel, the host, says chattily, ''is sex.'' What does a young person do about it? ''Main Street,'' an NBC News production, will be seen on Channel 4 at 4 P.M.

title: Policeman Dies, 11 Hurt In Fighting in Beirut
description: A policeman was killed and 11 civilians were wounded in artillery duels between the Christian and Moslem parts of the Lebanese capital today.

title: WILEY, JOHN & SONS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 31
Let's Not Abolish New York's Borough Presidents in Haste
description: To the Editor:

title: BAY PACIFIC HEALTH CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net income.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: Because of a transmission error, an article in Business Day on Feb. 24 about the Indonesian airline Garuda misidentified the Hindu god who rode the mythical bird for which the airline is named. The god is Vishnu.

title: BUDGET LEADERS DISCUSS '87 RISE IN U.S. REVENUE
description: The chairmen of the House and Senate Budget Committees are discussing a revenue increase of about $16 billion for the 1987 budget, aides said today.

title: THEORY OF FIFTH FORCE SPURS NEW EXPERIMENTS AND A SHARP DEBATE
description: WAS Galileo wrong when he hypothesized that any object - whether it is a feather, a cannon ball or a huge boulder - would fall at the same speed in a vacuum?

title: REAGAN BID STIRRING LONGSTANDING LABOR DEBATE
description: A longstanding dispute in the labor movement over foreign policy is breaking into the open again over President Reagan's request to Congress to use $100 million in Defense Department funds for military and other assistance to rebels seeking to overthrow the Nicaraguan Government.

title: Auschwitz Needs Prayer of Every Kind
description: To the Editor:

title: Matsushita Subsidiary
description: The Matsushita Electric Industrial Company, Japan's largest maker of electric and electronic consumer products, said today that it would establish a West German subsidiary to produce mechanism blocks for videotape recorders.

title: RECOVERY EFFORT BEGINS FOR CHALLENGER BOOSTER
description: A robot submersible descended to the ocean floor today to help the crew of a Scottish salvage ship begin recovery of a 4,200-pound piece of wreckage from the space shuttle Challenger's left-hand booster rocket, space agency officials said.

title: RACING TO GO ON AT MEADOWLANDS
description: The Meadowlands Race Track will remain open Tuesday night despite a continuing labor dispute between the agency that runs the facility and horsemen.

title: ASTRONAUT ASSAILS NASA FOR NOT TELLING OF RISK
description: HOUSTON, March 3 - A senior astronaut said today he was very upset that he and other astronauts were not informed that the space shuttle had a chronic problem with seals on its booster rockets.

title: EXECUTIVES
description: * American Stores Co., Salt Lake City, has appointed Donald H. Kohler president of Alpha Beta Co., a subsidiary.

title: July 4 a la Francais
description: The fireworks for display in honor of the Statue of Liberty's 100th anniversary will not be made in America.

title: AVANT-GARDE COMPUTING INC reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 31
description: b-Net income.

title: FLAW IN TOXIC LEAK SAID TO BE COMMON
description: The death of a worker at a Kerr-McGee nuclear fuel plant in Oklahoma stemmed from a safety violation that occurred often, rather than rarely or never, as the company had maintained, Federal officials said yesterday.

title: INTERCARE INC reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 31
Paul Scofield to Appear In London 'Rappaport'
description: Paul Scofield has been signed for the London production of ''I'm Not Rappaport,'' which will open July 14 at the Apollo Theater.

title: BASKETBALL CELEBRITIES AT $40 A MONTH
description: Pat Mason and Tracey Pridgen knew all about the glory of victory and the agony of defeat when they signed to play professional basketball for a team in this grimy provincial town, but, as they now realize, they did not quite reckon with the dreariness of athletic duty or Polish standards of living.

title: PLEA FOR 2 TRIALS REJECTED IN NAVY SPY CASE
description: A Federal district judge today rejected a defense request to hold two trials, one on espionage charges and the other on accusations of tax evasion, for a retired Navy communications specialist accused of spying for the Soviet Union.

title: NATIONAL HOMES CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Including an extraordinary credit of $224,000 for the quarter and year. c-After a loss of $782,000 from discontinued operations for the quarter and year. The year-ago result also includes a $2,100,000 provision for plant closedowns and a $780,000 gain on sale of certain assets. d-Net loss. There were no share earnings in the latest period after preferred stock dividends.

title: WINE TALK
description: AMERICANS have fallen out of love with table wine. No one is predicting that the rift is permanent, but the ardor of the 1970's has cooled. No one is prepared to say when, if ever, the good old euphoric days will return. Indeed, many Americans have become smitten with a new pop wine - the wine cooler - a newcomer whose sales have been extraordinary.

title: DANCE: TROUPES OF MARIA ALBA AND IBRAHIM FARRAH
description: THE number of Americans onstage performing dances from Spain and the Middle East on Sunday night at Carnegie Hall proved again that ethnic dance is an art form that appeals to all nationalities.

title: Lazard Freres Barred From a Bonding Role
description: Lazard Freres & Company, the investment bankers, will not be able to participate in the underwriting of the city's first garbage treatment plant because the former Sanitation Commissioner went to work for the company.

title: FOR COOKERY NEW AND OLD, THE LIBRARY'S A PLACE TO LOOK
description: THE staid halls of the New York Public Library may seem an unlikely site for a gathering of food buffs. But from Friday night through Saturday, chefs, restaurateurs, enophiles and food writers will join scholars, historians and scientists to wine, dine and talk about gastronomy from A to Z. The conference, sponsored by the library and subsidized by the General Foods Corporation, underscores the role of culinary collections as resources for interested amateurs and professionals.

title: SUMMARY OF '69 REPORT RELEASED ON THE KILLING OF ROBERT KENNEDY
description: The Los Angeles Police Commission today released an expurgated version of the summary of a 17-year-old police report on the assassination of Senator Robert F. Kennedy. Critics said the commission's report contained nothing that was not published in a 1970 book by the department's chief of detectives.

title: BOOTHE FINANCIAL CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Topics; Parklock / Footprints: Central Park Choke
description: Spring is at hand and as surely as the buds come to the cherry trees in New York's Central Park, Mayor Koch will again yield to the pressure to close the park to auto traffic much of the day. He will cause havoc for the many to serve the rural fantasies of a handful.

title: SUBURBS DELAY CUOMO'S PLAN ON ELITE SCHOOLS
description: Opposition from Westchester and Long Island school officials is delaying Governor Cuomo's efforts to create showcase regional high schools in the arts, science and mathematics around the state.

title: THE DANCE: CENTRAL BALLET OF CHINA
description: BALLET is an international language that is spoken in various countries with different regional accents. In the accomplished young dancers of the Central Ballet of China, who have come here to dance everything from ''Swan Lake'' to their own folk legends, we come across something rare in the ballet world - a determined and successful attempt to speak what is basically a foreign language.

title: FORMER DETAINEE, TORTURED UNDER MARCOS, SAYS HE ISN'T SOLD ON AQUINO
description: When Romeo Castillo walks at night, he worries that he may see someone open the trunk of a car.

title: While the Checks Are Clearing . . .
description: Banks are earning millions at the expense of depositors who are denied access to their money, ostensibly while deposited checks clear. That takes a day or two nowadays, according to the Federal Reserve, even with most out-of-state checks. Yet many banks persist in holding the money captive while using this ''float'' for profit.

title: COAST GUARD BRACES FOR FLEET OF 40,000 AT STATUE CENTENNIAL
description: A fleet of 40,000 cabin cruisers, sailboats, motor launches, ferryboats and yachts - not to mention 100 tall ships - is expected to sail into New York Harbor over the July 4th weekend for the Statue of Liberty centennial. And the Coast Guard is planning a major naval exercise to handle this extraordinary waterborne audience.

title: Transactions
description: BASEBALL METS (NL) - Signed Doug Sisk, pitcher, to a one-year contract. BASKETBALL

title: Texaco, Pennzoil Fail to Set Talks
description: Despite the prospect of years of litigation, mounting legal fees and financial uncertainties, Texaco Inc. and the Pennzoil Company have not restarted talks aimed at settling their dispute out of court, officials of both companies said yesterday.

title: A NEW KITCHEN FOR A LONDON LANDMARK
description: When asked, as he inevitably is these days, why London's famous Savoy Hotel needed a new kitchen, Anton Edelmann, the hotel's 33-year-old head chef, has a pat reply. ''The old kitchen was the same age as I am,'' he says. Then he describes in detail the quaint coal-burning stove that occasionally belched smoke into the hotel foyer as waiters dashed in and out of the kitchen to fetch orders.

title: Economic Scene; The Yen Also Rises
description: THE dollar/yen exchange rate will be the key factor determining whether and when the United States can eliminate its enormous trade deficit, which totaled $150 billion last year.

title: IN YEAR OF COACH, FOUR RATE AT TOP
description: With all due respect to Villanova's Rollie Massimino, who points out that every year is ''the year of the player,'' there seem to be certain seasons when coaching becomes the dominant factor in a team's success.

title: PREFERRED FINANCIAL CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Including tax credits of $12,000 for the quarter and $38,000 for the year.

title: PIEDMONT NATURAL GAS CO reports earnings for 3mo to Jan 31
description: b-After an extraordinary gain of $770,541 from defeasance of bonds which occurred in April 1985.

title: Bruno Stops Coetzee
description: Frank Bruno, the European heavyweight champion, knocked out Gerrie Coetzee of South Africa at 1 minute 50 seconds of the first round of a scheduled 12-round fight last night in Wembley, England, and now the 24-year-old Briton is looking for a shot at the World Boxing Association heavyweight title. The Bruno-Coetzee fight was an elimination for a chance at the title held by Tim Witherspoon, and a British promoter has already booked Wembley's 100,000-seat soccer stadium for such a match in June.

title: The U.N. Today: March 5, 1986
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY Committee on the Elimination of Racial Discrimination - 10:30 A.M. and 3 P.M. ECONOMIC AND

title: TO KEEP ITS SAILORS, NAVY WOOS WIVES
description: ON appointed mornings, fair weather or foul, a cluster of women can be seen standing on a point of rocks here, scanning Long Island Sound with binoculars.

title: DEVILS DEFEATED BY CAPITALS
description: Greg Adams of the Devils had perhaps the best explanation for the Washington Capitals' 4-2 victory tonight at Capital Centre.

title: KOCH TIGHTENS RESIDENCY RULE FOR CITY'S AIDES
description: The Koch administration, stung by the news that a former commissioner lived outside the city in violation of the Mayor's own rule, will make it more difficult for new management employees to live beyond the city limits.

title: Iran Reports 12 Killed In Iraqi Raid on Civilians
description: Iran reported 12 civilians killed and 72 wounded today in Iraqi air attacks on the Iranian town of Shadgan. Iraq denied that its planes attacked civilian areas.

title: FOR FILIPINO IN EXILE, THE LONG WAIT IS OVER
description: Nine years ago Eugenio Lopez Jr. escaped from prison in the Philippines and was smuggled out of the country in a small private plane. Now he has gone home.

title: SCREEN: DOCUMENTARY PAYS HOMAGE TO GAUDI
description: BUILDINGS seldom make good leading men: they neither move nor speak. A film about buildings has to compensate for protagonists who, despite their handsome facades, are inert -usually the camera must do the walking; a narrator's voice must provide the speech.

title: Venture for Dow
description: The Dow Chemical Company and the Martin Marietta Corporation said they would form a new company to market specialty chemical products in the steel, chemical and snow and ice removal industries. The joint venture is expected to have more than $200 million in sales in its first year of operation, a Dow spokesman said. The new company will have about 1,080 employees.

title: 12 QUIT CHASE LONDON UNIT
description: Chase Manhattan Ltd., the London investment banking unit of the Chase Manhattan Bank, confirmed yesterday that 12 Eurobond salesmen and traders had left and joined Kleinwort, Benson Ltd., a competitor in London.

title: THE THEATER: 'ROSEN,' NEW PLAY BY HOROVITZ
description: ''A ROSEN BY ANY OTHER NAME'' is the second chapter in Israel Horovitz's affectionate trilogy of plays about Jewish family life in Sault Ste. Marie, Ontario, in the 1940's. Unifying the plays is the character of Ardenshensky, a lovable wise man personified by Sol Frieder.

title: DELTONA CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After an extraordinary charge of $1,510,000 for the quarter and including gains of $20,786,000 from the sale of property, $3,988,000 from tax credit , both for the year. c-Including gains from discontinued operations of $232,000 for the quarter and $559,000 for the year. d-Net loss.

title: BUDGET SHADOW HITS MAIL TO VOTERS
description: With no small amount of distaste, Congress is approaching a budget pinch that affects a cherished privilege, particularly in an election year: the ability to send mail to constituents at taxpayer expense.

title: GUIDRY, RANDOLPH NAMED CAPTAINS
description: In a ceremony that prompted club executives to shed their casual spring training attire and don blazers and ties, the Yankees named Ron Guidry and Willie Randolph co-captains of the team today. They are the first co-captains in Yankee history, which has seen only six previous captains.

title: France Returns a Yacht Seized From Greenpeace
description: The Greenpeace yacht Vega, which the French Navy seized last Oct. 24 in a restricted zone around the Mururoa Atoll nuclear test zone in the South Pacific, has been returned to the environmentalist organization, officials said today.

title: CAR SALES OFF 25.6% IN FEB. 21-28 PERIOD
description: New-car sales plunged 25.6 percent in the last selling period in February from the corresponding period last year, the major domestic auto makers reported today. The decline came as most of the companies substituted less attractive interest rate incentive programs.

title: GTS CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net income.

title: SYLVIA JAFFIN LIESE
description: Sylvia Jaffin Liese, a retired Family Court judge and a former assistant district attorney in Manhattan, died Sunday at her home in Tucson, Ariz. She was 76 years old.

title: Key Rates
description: * Municipal Bond Index, The Bond BuyerSalomon Brothers estimates for bellwether issues

title: LEADING INDICATOR INDEX DOWN 0.6% IN JANUARY
description: The Government's index of economic predictors registered an unexpected decline in January after six straight monthly advances, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: Comment of U.S. Aide Upsets Israeli Embassy
description: A United States official has angered Israeli Embassy officials by saying that some bombings by Israel of Beirut could be called terrorism and that some Palestinian actions could be called legitimate resistance against Israel.

title: What's Right With Keeping 200,000 G.I.'s in Europe; Share the Cost
description: To the Editor:

title: NORTHERN AIR FREIGHT reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net income.

title: DYNAMIC HOMES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 28
description: b-Net income.

title: ALL BRINY, ALL TASTY, AND ALL OYSTERS
description: THEIR legends are legion and not entirely to be believed:

title: LLOYD'S SHUNS BOYCOTT PLAN
description: Lloyd's of London is not planning to boycott business in the United States, an official of the insurance organization said today.

title: POLORON PRODUCTS reports earnings for Year to Nov 30
description: b-Including a gain of $1,531,000 from an extraordinary item. c-Including a gain of $1,167,000 from an extraordinary item.

title: OFFICES SET FOR A LOFT ON 9th AVENUE
description: PROPERTY values are rising sharply west of Pennsylvania Station as investors promote the redevelopment of this long-neglected section of Manhattan and tenants move in to find cheaper alternatives to the high-cost space of midtown office buildings.

title: 'CRIME INC.,' A 7-PART SERIES ON MAFIA
description: INCREASINGLY in recent seasons, public broadcasting's WNYC has been doing good and ambitious programs. ''Crime Inc.,'' a seven-part series that starts at 9 o'clock tonight on Channel 31, is enormously ambitious, but on the basis of the first episode, it may be only inconsistently good. Sometimes its British antecedents get in the way.

title: ELIZABETH EYERLY
description: Elizabeth Eyerly, a retired Manhattan advertising executive, died of cancer yesterday at a nursing home in Mamaroneck, N.Y. She was 85 years old and had homes in Manhattan and Weston, Conn.

title: MEESE SUPPORTS DRUG-TESTING FOR U.S. EMPLOYEES
description: Attorney General Edwin Meese 3d today defended as constitutional a plan for widespread testing of Government employees for drug use, proposed Monday by the President's Commission on Organized Crime.

title: ARDEN INTERNATIONAL reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 28
description: b-Including gains from extraordinary items of $45,000 for the quarter and $105,000 for the year. The year result also includes a loss of $71,000 from discontinued operations. c-Net losses after losses from discontinued operations of $1,269,000 for the quarter and $1,369,000 for the year.

title: WEDNESDAY SPORTS
description: Basketball Nets vs. Milwaukee Bucks, at Byrne Meadowlands Arena. (Television -SportsChannel, 7:30 P.M. Radio -WPAT 930, 7:30 P.M.) College Tournaments: Big East, at Madison Square Garden, playoff for the final spot in the tournament.

title: ASSEMBLAGE OF SCIENTISTS IS ELATED AS SOVIET CRAFT SENDS COMET DATA
description: An unmanned Soviet spacecraft today sent back data from its first close glimpse of Halley's comet to international observers, both scientists and machines, assembled at the Institute for Space Research.

title: Slow to Develop
description: Jim Boudreau, as the son of Lou Boudreau, a Hall of Fame shortstop, has never lived up to the expectations of his illustrious father. Now, however, after four struggling years in the lower minor leagues, the 26-year-old son, a former Arizona State star, may be on the verge of winning a major league berth with the Baltimore Orioles.

title: ANIXTER BROTHERS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 31
IU INTERNATIONAL CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After losses from discontinued operations of $15,816,000 for the quarter and $97,370,000 for the year and losses on the disposal of discontinued operations of $97,493,000 and $67,257,000 for the quarter and year, respectively. c-Net income after losses from discontinued operations of $4,775,000 for the quarter and $15,714,000 for the year. The 1984 results have been restated to segregate General Waterworks Corp. and Ryder-P-I-E Nationwide Inc. as discontinued operations.

title: STARRETT PROPOSES HOUSING PROJECT AT URBAN-RENEWAL SITE IN QUEENS
description: The Starrett Housing Corporation, one of New York City's leading builders, is proposing to build a $1 billion apartment development for 4,000 to 6,000 families in a long-stalled urban-renewal project in Queens.

title: PAINKILLER IN TYLENOL IS LINKED TO LIVER DAMAGE IN ALCOHOLICS
description: Medical scientists warned yesterday that acetaminophen, the painkiller in Tylenol and many other aspirin substitutes, can cause serious liver damage in alcoholics. Two experts recommended that chronic, heavy drinkers not use the drug and called on the Federal Government to require that warnings of the danger be included on product labels.

title: Pinch-Hitter
description: ''You're it.''

title: HIGH SCHOOL COURSE IS SHATTERING MYTHS ABOUT AIDS
description: Before AIDS education began at Murry Bergtraum High School in Manhattan, misconceptions and wild fears about the disease abounded.

title: Jobless West Germans
description: The number of unemployed West Germans last month, representing 10.4 percent of the nation's work force, changed little from January but was down a bit from a year earlier. The Government said today that 2.59 million people were out of work in February, up one-tenth of 1 percent from January but down seven-tenths of 1 percent from February 1985.

title: The Lie Detectors
description: We need some lie detectors around here.

title: IN 2 3/4-HOUR HEARING, COUNCIL ASKS WARD ABOUT THE BASICS
description: It went on and on yesterday, in the half-empty City Council chamber, and when the questioning was over Police Commissioner Benjamin Ward laughed and said: ''Suppose they didn't like me. They say I'm doing a terrific job and keep me there two and a half hours.''

title: GUIDELINES URGED TO AVOID BUILDING FAILURES
description: Construction engineers today recommended new guidelines aimed at rooting out flaws in the design of buildings to avoid disasters like the 1981 collapse of walkways in a hotel here that killed 114 people.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: ''He should practice the magic of Manila on Managua.'' - Speaker Thomas P. O'Neill Jr., on President Reagan's Nicaragua policy. [ A4:3. ]

title: Bridge: 'Idle' Bid Put to Good Use In Preparing for a Defense
description: The Puritans used to claim that Satan finds work for idle hands to do. Nowadays devilishly clever bridge theorists find work for idle bids to do.

title: OAK HILL SPORTSWEAR reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Including a tax credit of $703,000 and an extraordinary net gain of $435,000 on the sale of business and related assets.

title: RATLIFF DRILLING & EXPLORATION COMPANY reports earnings for Year to Sept 30
description: b-After a writedown of about $11.6 million of 17 drilling rigs. c-After a loss of $1.7 million from discontinued operations.

title: Canadian Newsprint
description: Canadian newsprint production fell 2.2 percent in January, reflecting lower exports to the United States, the Canadian Pulp and Paper Association said today. Canada's mills produced 772,000 metric tons in January, down from 789,000 a year before. A metric ton is about 2,205 pounds.

title: Danish Pride
description: ''Jeg vil benytte lejligheden til at takke Handelsbanken for deres gave,'' said the Parks and Recreation Commissioner, Henry J. Stern.

title: B-Minor Mass Planned
description: The 40-voice Musica Sacra will perform Bach's Mass in B minor next Wednesday at 7:30 P.M. in Avery Fisher Hall, with an orchestra of 39 musicians under the direction of Richard Westenburg.

title: CSI TELEMARKETING reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 31
description: b-Net income including tax credits of $4,000 for the quarter and $104,000 for the 9 months. The 9 months' result also is after a loss of $41,000 from discontinued operations.

title: The Doctor Who Won An Antitrust Suit
description: To the Editor:

title: MEDICAL STUDENTS LEARN LEGAL ROPES
description: Margaret Slather sat flustered on the witness stand, twisting her hands as the defense attorney questioned her about how thoroughly she had examined the rape victim.

title: Rebels in Peru Are Reported To Kill 4 in a Raid on Town
description: Maoist guerrillas shot and killed four men, including local officials, and burned down the city hall in a southeastern Peruvian town, security force sources said today.

title: Topics; Parklock / Footprints: Portman and Peachtree
